answerText: EDTA [or ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid; or diaminoethane-tetraacetic acid; or edetic acid; or ethylenedinitrilo-tetraacetic acid][10] Metals chelated by EDTA usually adopt this molecular geometry, which consists of six ligands and no lone pairs.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | MCTC | 12 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this hexadentate ligand commonly used for complexometic titrations. It has four carboxylic acid moieties.
